utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: 911, what’s your emergency?

utterance.speaker: VAL BUTLER
utterance.content: You have to help me. Please. I only have a few seconds left.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: Ma’am, what’s your address?

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: 250 Avenue C. Please hurry.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: We’ll send help right away. Can you tell me what’s happening?

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: Ma’am? I need you to tell me what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: Ma’am, can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: The lights went out. It’s coming for me.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: What’s coming for you, ma’am? Ma’am? Ma’am?

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: I’m gonna die.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: Ma’am, are you there? Hello? Ma’am? Are you there? Hello?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hear that? That call came in at 11:59 from our vic, Val Butler. She’s an ad exec downtown. First responders came moments later. That door was locked and that couch was in front of it. No sign of forced entry.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. She looks like she’s been scared to death. Literally.

utterance.speaker: SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Is that based on your vast medical experience, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Based on the fact she looks like an Edvard Munch painting. Really freaky.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was the cause of death?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, there’s no external trauma. No puncture or stab wounds. Once I get her on the slab I’ll know more about how she died and who did it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it was a who.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning she said, “it’s coming for me”. Not he or she, but it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at what she was researching here. “How to keep away evil.” “How to ward off evil spirits.” A book on urban legends. Over by the door, horseshoes. I count two Indian wind chimes, there and there. These are things used to ward off evil spirits. Like Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I heard that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you saying, Castle? Oh, was the boogey man out to get her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m saying maybe that’s what she thought. Why she said “it’s coming for me”. Why the lights went out. Why she inexplicably died and why she looked so scared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was scared because she was about to be killed. By an actual person. So we should spend our time looking for that person. Let’s set up a canvass and talk to everyone in the building that might have seen or heard something.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: What happened to Val? What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: I work nights as a research assistant at the college. But I should have stayed home last night. I knew something was up with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: She’s been weird the last couple of days. She hadn’t been eating or sleeping. She was really paranoid, always locking the doors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she say what was wrong?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: I asked, but she said she didn’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amanda, do you know of anyone that may have wanted to hurt her?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Her ex-boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Boyfriend’s name is Freddie Baker, 31. Quite the resume. Resisting arrest, assault and battery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like a prince.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Val wised up, though. She filed a restraining order against him after they broke up. Esposito’s checking into where he was last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’d we get from Val’s family and friends?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just that they hadn’t heard from her in the last three days. She wasn’t returning their messages.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Three days. That’s how long Val’s roommate said she had been acting strangely.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. So I dug into the last 72 hours of her life. Besides a credit card charge for a train ticket to Greenwich there was nothing else unusual.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was she doing in Greenwich?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re still looking into that, but as far as abnormalities for the last few days that was it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no. There’s more. The wind chime, the horseshoe, the book on urban legends. All bought online two days ago. Almost as if Val thought some sort of evil spirit was coming for her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what she thought was going to happen versus what actually happened are two completely different things.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, because if Val was a victim of anything it was her lousy taste in men. Canvass popped. One of her neighbors saw Freddie in the building an hour before her death.

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE BAKER
utterance.content: I’d never hurt Val. I loved her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Then how do you explain this restraining order that she filed against you? Was that a love letter?

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: A misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we have a witness that saw you in Val’s apartment last night.

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: But I didn’t kill her. Yes, I went over there. But only because she begged me to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you actually expect us to believe that she invited you over to her apartment after she filed a restraining order?

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: It’s true. She said she wanted to get back together. But when I got there all she did was accuse me of sending her some package.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What package?

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: I have no idea. But when I told her I didn’t send her anything, she started freaking out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How was she freaking out?

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: She kept saying, “It’s real.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s real?

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. She wasn’t making any sense. She kept asking me if I believed in the power of evil.

utterance.speaker: FREDDIE
utterance.content: I didn’t want to get in trouble for breaking the R.O. so I went to hang out with friends, but when I left the apartment Val was alive. I swear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Freddie’s alibi checks out. Friends confirm that he met them at 11. They hung out at a club until dawn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he’s not our guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’ll just point out that Val asked him if he believed in the power of evil and then was talking about how it was real. I hate to say it –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then don’t. Did CSU find a package at her apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but they were looking for evidence of a murder, not mail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe that’s what freaked Val out. She knew that that package was coming from her killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You find anything yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. A closet with more stilettos than yours. Didn’t think it was possible. How about you? Any luck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yes. Looks like there’s a package that she got. It had a CD or a DVD, so be on the lookout for a disc.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Disc. Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: VIDEO
utterance.content: Help me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett? Can you come here?

utterance.speaker: VIDEO
utterance.content: You saw. On midnight of the third day, you die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay? You find something?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When did you say Val got that package?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Three days before she died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was midnight on the third day. She died because she saw this disc. And now I saw it. Which means I’m next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Legend tells of a mysterious video that can harness the forces of evil from the beyond. The disc is a harbinger of grave misfortune, marking its watchers to certain and unavoidable death. I saw it, just like Val did. That’s why she said “it’s coming for me”. That’s how she knew when she was going to die. Why she was trying to ward off spirits. Because of the message on that disc.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How’s a DVD going to kill you? Is it going to come at you like a ninja star? Cut your head off?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The actual DVD will not kill me, Esposito. It will be the spirit inside the DVD. Just like in The Ring.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, the one with the creepy, waterlogged little girl that crawls out of the TV. I didn’t sleep for days after that movie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes! Exactly! Thank you. That movie. It’s fiction. It’s a horror story in a book about urban legends.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, because that’s … all it is, right? A legend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Many legends are based in truth. I saw the video. At midnight in three days’ time I will die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Castle, that message wasn’t for you. It was a threat, for Val. And it wasn’t made by spirits. It was made by her murderer. So, tracing the disc to whoever sent it should lead us straight to him. Espo –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s a PO Box on this air bill. Will you look into it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Ryan, why don’t you take a look at this disc and see –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, um … I’m sorry. What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: E tu, bro?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you say about the story being a legend?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um, well … uh … Jenny and I, we are trying to make a baby, so we’re abiding by every superstition in the book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Here, Espo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … nah. I can’t. I can’t watch that. If I watch that it’s going to make my partner out to be a wimp.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I can’t have that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, bro.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is so pathetic. Okay, fine. I will watch it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, no. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m doing my job. Someone here has to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, think of the risks. You may not think there’s anything to this, but what if you’re wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I appreciate your concern, but it’s just a DVD.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No – you just can’t play it. Let me take precautions here. Don’t want the whole precinct suffering my fate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. You want to hold my hand?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m not scared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I wasn’t asking for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does it matter?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are those sounds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It gets worse. Wait for it.

utterance.speaker: VIDEO
utterance.content: You saw. Midnight on the third day, you die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. It is kinda creepy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because the killer made it creepy, Castle. Maybe those images meant something to the victim. Clues to the relationship between her and the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Go back. That one – that one there. That’s the um … that’s the Tibetan Wheel. It symbolizes rebirth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hang on, that is the Masonic Compass. That’s – they felt it represented resurrection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your point being?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rebirth? Resurrection? This video obviously resurrects something from the great beyond. Something dangerous. Something murderous. I mean, what other explanation can there be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are plenty of explanations, Castle. And none of them are supernatural. In fact, I bet Perlmutter has our cause of death by now. Those tox and autopsy reports should be done.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, Detective Beckett. And defective Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Perlmutter. How was Val Butler killed?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It appears she died of heart failure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At 27?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have heart problems?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, she certainly did once it stopped beating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What made it stop? Is it possible she was poisoned? Or OD’ed on drugs?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Nothing showed up on her blood panels.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about what caused her … um …

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, post mortem contractions of the facial muscles are not unheard of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t know what killed her.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I wouldn’t say that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have a theory?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Not at the present time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That means you don’t know. And the only explanation is that Val faced something so scary it stopped her heart and froze her face in the last expression she had. Terror. Admit it.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: All I’ll say, Mr. Castle, is that for now cause of death is unknown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unknown. Hear that? Not good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Checking my bucket list. See how many things I can get done in two days. Can either one of you introduce me to Bill Shatner?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Finding who sent this disc should make Castle feel a whole lot better.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. But what if the worst happens and Castle’s right? Do you think he put me in his will?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude. Uncool.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? I’m just wondering. I mean, Castle’s death will be sad and all, but his Ferrari sure would lessen my grief.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You do realize that even putting that out in the universe is bad karma.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Please. Castle’s not going to die. We’re not dealing with an evil spirit. We’re dealing with a guy who has a return address.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Why does everyone keep asking about box 1135?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, who else has been asking about it?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Some brunette chick came in here a couple days ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Probably Val. What did you tell her?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Nothing, bro. It’s against company policy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I think this trumps company policy so, who owns the box?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Ah, that’s the weird thing. Guy who owns it died like, three months ago. So he couldn’t have sent that package, unless he sent it from the great beyond.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The box was last rented by an Andrew Levine who died of liver failure three months ago. Somehow I don’t think he’s connected to this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the killer covered his tracks. He must have written a random PO Box on the packaging slip.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Ryan! There is no "or".

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m just saying, maybe the reason we can’t trace the package’s origins is because it was sent from another realm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan is right. It was sent from another realm. New Jersey. I looked into the air bill number on Val’s package. Turns out it’s one in a sequence of air bills all sent from the same guy. Jason Bennett. Lives in Hoboken.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey bro, I just want you to know ­– – just thought you should know that I really value our friendship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s priceless to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But if we could put a price on it, what would it be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I just want to know how much our friendship would be worth if you were, you know –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dead!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got to Bennett too late.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, uh … about two days too late. That looks like about how long he’s been dead. He couldn’t have killed Val.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he got a package with a disc in it just like Val four days ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There was a blackout here, too. Same MO, same freaky ass body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Third day at midnight. I knew I shouldn’t have let you watch that disc. Now in 48 hours we’ll both be dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU just found a stack of air bills at Jason’s place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then the killer used one of them to send the disc to Val.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should make a copy of the DVD and send it to someone else. That’s how they saved people in The Ring.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but all those people that got a copy died.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and you’d just be passing the buck off to someone else. That’s cold, bro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, does anyone have a better solution? Because we need one. If not for me, at least for Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s so sweet. You want me to outlive you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Who else is going to tell my tale of sacrifice and selflessness?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we won’t be telling anyone anything. We’re both going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you say that when we have not one, but two dead DVD watchers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s gotta be a better connection between our two victims than that disc. Ryan, can you check in with Jason’s family, see if anyone recognizes Val?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, why don’t you cross reference their records and see if there’re any similarities between the two of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, if there are going to be pictures of us hanging up there we should really pick them out now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Castle - - we could always use the photo I took of you in bed the other night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know if that’s how I want to be remembered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I was joking. There will be no photos of us on that murder board. By tomorrow we are going to find a connection between our two victims that will lead us straight to a flesh and blood killer. In the meantime, it’s getting kinda late, ‘kay? So why don’t we just call it a night? You know what? Actually, we could go back to my place tonight and take some more photos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I might be convinced – whoa, wait a minute. In every horror movie I’ve ever seen - - having sex pretty much guarantees we will die. So for the safety of us both, I say we just … hold off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure? I mean, think about it, Castle. This could be our last time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s – – okay, what you’re doing? Right now? This is not helping. This – I’m gonna remove myself from temptation. A good night’s sleep will give me some perspective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is –

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wes! Hey, it’s Rick!

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Geez Rick, it’s after midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry. I just, um – I need some advice.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Is Stephan King beating you at Texas Hold’em again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? No, but um – this is actually about your movies. I mean, the name Wes Craven is synonymous with horror. You’ve made a fortune

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: So you call me up in the middle of the night to join my fan club? What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ha ha. No. I know that you’ve researched evil spirits who reach out from the beyond for all your films.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Well, of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was just wondering if you knew how to stop those pesky suckers.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Is this you making your own movie? I mean, are you writing a horror screenplay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. I just thought I’d give you a little friendly competition. Just got a little writer’s block is all.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Okay, what’s the story?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … ruggedly handsome hero and his notoriously practical lady friend watch a disc that’s killing its viewers within three days.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Really? You don’t think that’s a little derivative?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes … but … I am hoping to distinguish the ending. You know, make the third act a survival tale rather than a blood bath. I just can’t figure out how to get my heroes out of this mess.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: So the key is always in the spirit’s origin story. Once you have that you can start to figure out the spirit’s weaknesses. If it’s using the disc as its portal into our world, then –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then the disc would contain clues as to the spirit’s story. Wes, thank you! Thank you. Listen buddy, it’s late. I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: WES CRAVEN
utterance.content: Friendly competition my ass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys have got to be kidding me. We didn’t find a single connection between our victims?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope. The two were as different as night and day.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jason was a retired ex-army doc, Val was a young Manhattan ad exec.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Val was born in Florida, Jason grew up in Idaho.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They didn’t share any friends, they weren’t family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And none of Jason’s relatives recognized Val’s photo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, and no one from Val’s family had seen or heard of Jason.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re still looking through their records, but so far nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’re at a dead end?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … maybe not. After much reflection, I realized the key to solving this is figuring out the story on the DVD. To that end, I crowd sourced one of the images to my legion of followers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And someone recognized it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you betcha. According to BedazzleCat39, you’re looking at the Brunswick Inn in Port Campbell.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bingo. Val’s credit card records show that she spent a few nights at the Brunswick Inn in November 2008.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And it looks like Jason crashed there too, also in November 2008.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so both of our victims stayed at that inn at the same time. So … maybe they were having an affair.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: In 2008 Val would have been … 24. Jason would have been 66 and an affair would have been –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gross.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I was going to say unlikely.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It doesn’t look like an affair. They stayed in separate rooms.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well the victims were at the inn and the inn was on the disc. There’s got to be a connection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The inn must be the place where some unspeakable horror befell the spirits. Think about it. The Ring, Psycho, The Shining. It’s when they get to the creepy old motel that everything starts really going south. So this must be the location of the spirit’s origin story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or, somehow Val and Jason connected with the human killer at that inn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My version’s better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you look into the Brunswick Inn. See if there are any red flags, past crimes. Castle and I’ll go to Port Campbell and see what we can find.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe I should … stay here. I mean, the inn is just one piece of the puzzle. I should really … check the other images on the video. See what I can figure out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, you’re volunteering to watch that thing again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s not like I can get any deader.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? It doesn’t look like there’s anyone here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It doesn’t look like anyone’s been here this century.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not buying into Castle’s spirit craziness, are you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. You think I’m afraid of some old campfire story? I’m a grown-ass man.

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: Need help?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just so you know, um… that was me being startled, not scared.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You run this place?

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: 41 years now. But you’re in the wrong place. We’re closed for the season.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We just need to ask you a few questions. Do you recognize these people? Val Butler and Jason Bennett. They – they stayed here back in 2008.

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: Long time ago, 2008. I’ve seen a lot of faces come and go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They would have been here in November. Do you remember anything unusual from that period?

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: You wouldn’t happen to know their room numbers?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. 213 and 313.

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: The 13’s. Those rooms, they’re not normal rooms. They’re reserved for people involved in trials at the courthouse. Down at 1135 Elm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 1135, that’s the same number as the PO Box on the package.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s gotta be it then. The murders have to be connected to a trial held at the courthouse in November of ’08.

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: There’s only one trial took place in November ’08. It was a terrible thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You remember a trial from five years ago?

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: No one here can forget. It was the trial of the century. That man murdered half a dozen people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: MITCH
utterance.content: Nigel Malloy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The serial killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is all about Nigel Malloy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It makes perfect sense. The clock tower from the DVD? It’s the same clock tower from the courthouse where he was tried.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The rooftop and the alley were the scenes of this third and fourth murders.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and Jason and Val? Both witnesses in his 2008 murder trial.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so somehow Nigel Malloy must be taking revenge against the people that testified against him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh yeah, there’s only one problem. Nigel Malloy is dead. He died in prison three years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nigel Malloy. They called him the Grim Reaper. His signature? Searing symbols – like the ones we saw in the video – into the flesh of his victims.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Turns out that Val and Jason were witnesses to the kidnapping of his first victim, Esther Alonzo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he abducted her from an amusement park in New Jersey. Tortured her in his basement for days before killing her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Had the local police running around in circles. They even arrested the wrong guy before capturing him five bodies later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, considering he died in prison, I’d say he’s got a pretty good alibi for our two murders. It’s gotta be someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t be so sure. Take a look at what Nigel Malloy said in an interview he did right before he died.

utterance.speaker: INTERVIEWER
utterance.content: So, Mr. Malloy. Are you saying you actually believe you can’t die?

utterance.speaker: NIGEL MALLOY
utterance.content: My victims gave me unique inside information into death. Into its secrets. Even when my body perishes my essence will continue on. I will continue on. You see, death is just the beginning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. That guy gives a whole new meaning to the word psycho.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder if did. Find a way to let his spirit live on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like the killer in those Chucky moves who transferred his spirit into that spooky doll.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Only instead of a doll it’s a DVD. That explains the message ‘you saw you die’. The witness saw his crimes so they must die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then given that logic we’d both be okay because – – we’re not witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you’re a cop! I’m a cop – helper. I mean, you don’t think a convicted serial killer is going to have an axe to grind with the NYPD?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, Nigel Malloy is not involved. He’s dead. But, someone else might be acting in his behalf. Ryan, talk to the DA in Port Campbell. Let’s locate those other witnesses and make sure they’re safe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The court records were sealed. How would the killer know who the witnesses were?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … wait a minute. Um, Nigel Malloy had a brother, Leopold. The DA accused him of helping dispose of the bodies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. The defense said that Nigel had an almost hypnotic hold over his brother.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was found not guilty by reason of insanity and they shipped him off to an asylum.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is he still there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m checking. Oh, wait, this is interesting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Asylum they send him to? It’s in Greenwich.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s where Val went the day she got the DVD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She went to see Leopold Malloy.

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. That young lady did stop by a few days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what they might have talked about or what he might have said to her?

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: I’m afraid not, dear. You’ll have to ask Mr. Malloy yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, not for nothing, but what’s he like? I mean, on a scale of one to Hannibal Lector, what are we dealing with here?

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: I’m sorry. But doctor/patient privilege prohibits us from characterizing or describing our patient’s behavior.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that’s okay. We understand.

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: Here we are. Let’s go over the rules. Please don’t had him any objects or take anything from him. Don’t stand too close to the glass. And if you need any help just press the red button on the door behind you. Okay, now please just sign here acknowledging that you understand the rules.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eeh. I feel like I’m signing my life away.

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: Well let’s hope not!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD MALLOY
utterance.content: Please, have a seat. I so rarely receive visitors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you have received a visitor recently. Val Butler. Why was she here?

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: Oh, sweet girl. She came to see if I’d sent her something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did you?

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: How could I? I can’t send anything to anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could have just gotten someone else to send it to her just like you could have gotten someone else to kill her.

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: And why would I do such a thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To perpetuate the myth of your brother’s immortality. Or to avenge his death.

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: I am not my brother’s keeper, Detective Beckett. I never was. And I don’t share his murderous impulses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet you’re still in here.

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: For now. But when my appeal comes through, who knows? We might all meet on the street one day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I might cross the street that day.

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: I’m no danger to anyone. I never was. So why would I jeopardize my appeal by being party to a murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you knew you could get away with it. You’re locked up. You have the perfect alibi.

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: I have the perfect alibi because I’m innocent. I don’t have TV or internet access. I don’t send or receive mail. The only personal contact I have is through visitors, and Val was the last one I’ve had in years. So who could I have sent to dispatch her or the other witness?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, we never actually said anything about the other witness being killed, so how would you know anything about that?

utterance.speaker: LEOPOLD
utterance.content: I think it’s time for you to go. I have nothing more to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, he told us everything. That slip up proves that he’s been talking to someone about those murders.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There is one other way he could have gotten that information. He could be talking to his brother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, he was talking to someone on the outside. He hasn’t been communing with the dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we can’t be sure. And we’re running out of time. So I’m going to scratch off number 27 on my bucket list. You remember that uh, blue porcelain vāse you had on your dining room table?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, the one the wind blew over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, about that. I was playing Wii Tennis in the living room –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You broke my vase?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vāse. Vase is acceptable too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? You can stop worrying about the spirits getting to you because I just might kill you myself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? You want to spend our last day on Earth fighting?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. We need you to subpoena the records from the asylum. See who Leopold was in contact with by phone or over email.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. But just so you know, there’s been a development.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean? What kind of development?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, while looking into the Malloys Nigel’s name came up on a police report.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a report?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was … reported missing … a few days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Missing? The guy has been dead for over three years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah … about that. The groundskeeper at the cemetery where Nigel was buried noticed that his plot has been … disturbed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As in dug up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, not just dug up. Nigel Malloy’s body has disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It hasn’t disappeared. He’s risen from the grave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, let’s hear it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hear what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your explanation for this. If there’s one thing I can always count on it’s you and your logic, so …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want me to explain the dead serial killer’s missing body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know what happened here. Yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s it? That’s all you’ve got?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But I can assure you it has nothing to do with Nigel Malloy rising from the dead. It’s his brother. Leopold Malloy is behind all of this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Doesn’t look like Leopold has anything to do with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy’s crazy, but he was right about one thing. He has no phone, no email, and no visitors besides Val.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s gotta be some way of proving that Leopold’s behind all of this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t tell you how he did it, but I can tell you who’s next. I checked into the court documents on the Malloy trial. I noticed a pattern. Jason was the first person to testify and he was also the first one to die. A day later Val, the second person to testify, was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so they’re being killed in order of their testimonies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s lucky number three?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … Mike Heller. I talked to his girlfriend. He received a disc three days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That means he’s due to die tonight at midnight. That’s in four hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where is Mike Heller now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s the problem. He watched the video and freaked out. He left the house. Nobody knows where he went.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I might. Heller’s financials show that he bought groceries at a store outside Kingston yesterday. His family owns a cabin up there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s probably where he’s holed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Esposito you keep digging into Leopold. Ryan, find the other witnesses. Make sure they’re safe. Castle and I’ll head off to Kingston and see if we can get Heller.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … we’re going to a cabin in the woods in the middle of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s like the coed checking out the strange noise in the basement in a slasher flick. It’s a recipe for disaster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not a slasher flick, it’s a murder investigation. And I’m going up to that cabin so … are you coming or what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I can’t let you go alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But I need to make a stop first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so I’ve got incense, palaspas, Ba Gua Mirror. This is a veritable war chest for fighting evil spirits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that holy water?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you get that from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A priest blessed this for me two years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you just keep it around?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Knew it would come in handy one day. Now, what weapon do you want?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I’ll be fine with my gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s not just one tiny part of you that wonders if I might be right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Uh – Ryan, I think we’re in a bad area. I’m having a hard time hearing you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay then I’ll make it quick. I just finished with the last of the remaining witnesses. None of them got a disc.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the killer only targeted the first three witnesses.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well either that or he hasn’t got around to the others yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dude, you’re breaking up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, hang on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, check this out. Looks like Val, Jason, and Mark Heller all had something else in common.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett? We missed something. It’s not what we think. It’s all –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t get him back. I don’t have any reception.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s Heller’s car. He’s here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I haven’t got any bars either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, we are in the middle of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can this get any worse? A dead serial killer has gone missing, we’ve both seen a cursed disc, we’re at a cabin in the woods with no cell phone reception. I don’t need Wes Craven to tell me how this ends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well think about it this way, Castle. In all of those horror movies someone survives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, someone. One of us. And the other one is cursed with being charming and funny. I don’t think I need to tell you what kind of chances the comic relief guy has.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mark Heller?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mark Heller?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez! Can’t say I’m a fan of the décor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, neither am I but we’re just here to find –

utterance.speaker: MARK HELLER
utterance.content: Unless you leave you’re gonna die.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Heller, I’m Detective Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Well then you won’t mind showing me ID. Can’t be too cautious, not with Malloy witnesses dropping like flies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we know about the disc. We’re here to take you to the Precinct where we can protect you.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: You can’t protect me. He’s back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look Mark, if the pattern holds, you’ve got two minutes before – – you know. So let’s talk about this in the car.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: You know, being in the same courtroom as Malloy was enough to make a grown man wet himself. Psycho yammering about death and rebirth and all that hoo-ha.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, hoo-ha we can be talking about in the –

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: You know, neither me nor Val nor Jason wanted to testify against him. Or the other guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean the other guy? Are you talking about Leopold?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Time’s up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s here. Do you think it’ll matter that we still have a day left, or will it be a three person one stone thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are your circuit breakers?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Outside, by the tool shed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone’s out there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? What’s it like? It is ghastly and pale? Pissed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t get a good look at his face. Do you have a back door?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, through the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Castle, you keep an eye on Mark. I’m gonna head out back, double around. See if I can surprise him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, what? We’re splitting up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Hold it right there!

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Why can’t he just leave us alone? We suffered so much all ready. The guilt nearly killed the three of us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would you have guilt about getting a serial killer convicted?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Because that’s not the whole story. We all have blood on our hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blood? What blood? Mark, talk to me. I need to know, what blood is on your hands?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: What does it matter? He’s come back for us. We’re all going to die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It matters because if you did something wrong it could be the key to getting out of this alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: Get off of me! Let me go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You? Leopold’s nurse? Leopold. It was you.

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: No. No!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re the one that’s killing for him.

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: No. No, you don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s how he got to the witnesses. He was using you.

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: You don’t get it! I’m not here to kill Heller. I’m here to save him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you even talking about?

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: That’s why Leopold sent me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Step back. Back!

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: All right!

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: He knew that people would think that he was behind the murders and then he wouldn’t be able to get out of the asylum. I love him. I was just trying to protect him. We knew we had to stop the murders. It – it’s not us. I swear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If it’s not you then who is it?

utterance.speaker: NURSE LOCKHEART
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I went to Nigel’s grave just to be sure. I dug it up. He was gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Evil spirits don’t kill. People do.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Before Nigel, the police arrested someone else. David Collier. Guy had a history of mental illness. Me, Val, and Jason had to pick him out of a lineup. None of us were sure, but the police, they just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They pressured you into saying it was Collier. What happened to him?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: He couldn’t take it. The accusations, what people were saying. He smashed a light bulb in his cell and used the wire to electrocute himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So his heart stopped. When did he die? Mark, exactly when did he die?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: At midnight. Third night he was in prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘You saw, midnight third day, you die.’ This isn’t about Nigel. It’s about Collier. Mark, you gotta think. Did he have any friends? Any relatives?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Yeah, he had a daughter. Amanda.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Val’s roommate’s name is Amanda. Someone’s here.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Your three days are up, Mark. The same three days of fear my father had.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stop right there!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow, right in my eyes!

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: The gun! I can’t see. Where is she?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: This is for my father.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? Told you this holy water would come in handy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So according to Amanda’s psych records, she suffered a mental break about a year ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That must be when she started fixating on revenge. Planning to punish all those who wrongly ID’ed her dad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, she must have cozied up to Val to find out where Jason and Mark were.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And she used this to knock them out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The mug?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, the taser. It’s a modified taser. Emits a disorienting light and amplified voltage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Enough voltage to stop a heart.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And make the facial muscles contract.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess Amanda wanted the people responsible for her father’s death to suffer the same way he did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So three days of fear capped with a dark, heart stopping death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but how did she get the power to go out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She used this. She attached it to the cabin’s circuit breaker. It emits a magnetic charge that interferes with the system. So, I guess that there is a logical explanation for everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. What about Nigel? How did his body go missing form his grave?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can answer that. Turns out, he was never buried. His body disappeared from the morgue shortly after his death. The police didn’t want to make it known, so they buried an empty coffin. But here’s the odd thing. His body was never found.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … he could still be out there … somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so … here’s to a job well done. And now you can finally get rid of this bucket … list … of yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that look for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘Be with Kate’? That’s your number one? When did you write this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What like, three years ago? Ooh! I can cross that one off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … um … Sorry, still one minute ‘til midnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you serious Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. I’m not taking any chances. This is one deadline I want to miss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you’re right. It would be a shame if something happened to us because there’s one thing on my bucket list that I would like to accomplish. And it involves a little trick that I do. With ice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, that sounds worth living for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Castle, ice is melting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just – Okay, just – I just – – in three … two …

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
